content: Hello everyone . im new to the site and i thought i would introduce myself. Ive been reading post on here for a while but just now decided to make and account so my question is... Would there be an issue with me going to the hospital for semi regular STD checks? I went about 6months ago and I would like to get checked again. now... i know to use protection and I'm very good about doing so but I've always heard that you should get checked up whenever/if ever you switch partners. And it just seems like good, safe practice to do so. I'm just wondering if I could get in trouble with it being on my records so much. I don't want to give the impression that I'm careless with my health or anything. Any kind of information you could give me would be great. Thanks
reply: Hello everyone . im new to the site and i thought i would introduce myself. Ive been reading post on here for a while but just now decided to make and account so my question is... title: healthcare question

content: Never mind them, silly troglodytes! But you have to expect that sort of inevitable response to a topic such as this on a forum such as this with an audience such as this. I don't know what the Air Force version of Preventive Health is (they may call it just that) - in the Army it's called "Force Health Protection" - but they'll be happy to test you. Frankly, who cares how many times it's in your medical records? Not every other person gets access to your records, you know, and though medical info gets leaked like rainwater in both military and civilian systems, it IS protected and private information. Personally, I think you're doing the smart thing ... but also hope you're not bed-hopping and switching partners more often than dancers at a hoe-down.

content: Yes, you could get into allot of trouble if it is put into your medical records. I once knew a whole squad of men who went to bed with the same woman and they all came down with the clap. They got treatment and it was put into their medical records. Some how the 1st Shirt found out about it and he had them all sent to Iraq. None have come back home yet and it has been 7 years.

content: I appreciate your replies and I hope thats Dr. Ruth calling me honey and not you. that'd be slightly uncomfortable I could also lock myself in a tiny windowless room and avoid ANY type of misfortune but I doubt anyone would honestly recommend that. There’s is nothing wrong with having sex as long as you’re smart and safe about it, which I already am. I’ve already stated that I take necessary precautions in protecting myself. I use condoms EVERY time and by no means do I “bed Hop”… I’m just trying to take every step to insure that I’m safe. But again, I appreciate everyone’s replies.
